00029   PSF* PSF::clone(void) const {
00030     return(new PSF(*this));
00031   }

00033   PSF PSF::copy(void) const {
00034     AtomicGroup grp = this->AtomicGroup::copy();
00035     PSF p(grp);
00036     
00037     // Add PSF specific member data copies here...
00038     return(p);
00039   }

00043   void PSF::read(std::istream& is) {
00044     std::string input;
00045 
00046     // first line is the PSF header
00047     if (!getline(is, input))
00048       throw(std::runtime_error("Failed reading first line of psf"));
00049     if (input.substr(0,3) != "PSF")
00050       throw(std::runtime_error("PSF detected a non-PSF file"));
00051 
00052     // second line is blank
00053     if (!getline(is, input))
00054       throw(std::runtime_error("PSF failed reading first header blank"));
00055 
00056     // third line is title header
00057     getline(is, input);
00058     int num_title_lines;
00059     if (!(std::stringstream(input) >> num_title_lines)) 
00060       throw(std::runtime_error("PSF has malformed title header"));
00061         
00062     // skip the rest of the title
00063     for (int i=0; i<num_title_lines; i++) 
00064       getline(is, input);
00065         
00066     // verify nothing went wrong
00067     if (!(is.good()))
00068       // Yes, I know, I should figure out what went wrong instead
00069       // of running home crying.  Sorry, Tod...
00070       throw(std::runtime_error("PSF choked reading the header"));
00071 
00072     // next line is blank 
00073     if (!getline(is, input))
00074       throw(std::runtime_error("PSF failed reading second header blank"));
00075 
00076     // next line is the number of atoms
00077     
00078     if (!getline(is, input))
00079       throw(std::runtime_error("PSF failed reading natom line"));
00080     int num_atoms;
00081     if (!(std::stringstream(input) >> num_atoms))
00082       throw(std::runtime_error("PSF has malformed natom line"));
00083 
00084     for (int i=0; i<num_atoms; i++) {
00085       if (!getline(is, input))
00086         throw(std::runtime_error("Failed reading PSF atom line "));
00087       //throw(std::runtime_error("Failed reading PSF atom line " + std::string(i)));
00088       parseAtomRecord(input);
00089     }
00090 
00091     // next line is blank 
00092     if (!getline(is, input))
00093       throw(std::runtime_error("PSF failed reading blank after atom lines"));
00094 
00095     // next block of lines is the list of bonds
00096     // Bond title line
00097     if (!getline(is, input))
00098       throw(std::runtime_error("PSF failed reading nbond line"));
00099     int num_bonds;
00100     if (!(std::stringstream(input) >> num_bonds))
00101       throw(std::runtime_error("PSF has malformed nbond line"));
00102 
00103     int bonds_found = 0;
00104     getline(is, input);
00105     while (input.size() > 0) { // end of the block is marked by a blank line
00106       int ind1, ind2;
00107       std::stringstream s(input);
00108       while (s.good()) {
00109         s >> ind1;
00110         s >> ind2;
00111         ind1--;  // our indices are 1 off from the numbering in the pdb/psf file
00112         ind2--;
00113         pAtom pa1 = getAtom(ind1);                
00114         pAtom pa2 = getAtom(ind2);                
00115         pa1->addBond(pa2);
00116         pa2->addBond(pa1);
00117         bonds_found++; 
00118       }
00119       getline(is, input);
00120     }
00121     // sanity check
00122     if (bonds_found != num_bonds) 
00123       throw(std::runtime_error("PSF number of bonds disagrees with number found"));
00124 
00125   }
00126 
00127 
00128 
00129   void PSF::parseAtomRecord(const std::string s) {
00130     gint index;
00131     std::string segname;
00132     gint resid;
00133     std::string resname;
00134     std::string atomname;
00135     std::string atomtype;
00136     greal charge;
00137     greal mass;
00138     gint fixed;
00139 
00140     pAtom pa(new Atom);
00141          
00142     std::stringstream ss(s);
00143 
00144     ss >> index;
00145     pa->id(index);
00146      
00147     ss >> segname;
00148     pa->segid(segname);
00149 
00150     ss >> resid;
00151     pa->resid(resid);
00152 
00153     ss >> resname;
00154     pa->resname(resname);
00155 
00156     ss >> atomname;
00157     pa->name(atomname);
00158 
00159     // If this is a charmm psf, the atomtype will be an integer.
00160     // NAMD/XPLOR psfs use the symbolic atomtype, which must start with a letter
00161     // At the moment, the Atom class doesn't care about this value (it's mostly
00162     // used in charmm and namd as a means to look up parameters), so we're going to
00163     // discard it.  However, if we ever decide we're going to use this, we'll need
00164     // to keep track of the distinction between charmm and namd usage.
00165     ss >> atomtype;
00166 
00167     ss >> charge;
00168     pa->charge(charge);
00169 
00170     ss >> mass;
00171     pa->mass(mass);
00172     pa->atomic_number(deduceAtomicNumber(pa));
00173 
00174     // Is the atom fixed or mobile?
00175     // for now, we're going to silently drop this
00176     ss >> fixed;  
00177 
00178     append(pa);
00179   }
00180 
00181 
00190   int PSF::deduceAtomicNumber(pAtom pa) {
00191     double mass = pa->mass();
00192     int an=-1;
00193     if (mass < 1.0)
00194       throw(std::out_of_range("Atomic mass less than 1.0 in psf"));
00195     else if (mass < 1.1) // Hydrogen = 1.0080
00196       an=1;
00197     else if ( (mass >= 4.0) && (mass <= 4.1) )  // Helium = 4.0026
00198       an=6;
00199     else if ( (mass >= 12.0) && (mass <= 12.1) )  // Carbon = 12.0110
00200       an=6;
00201     else if ( (mass >= 14.0) && (mass <= 14.1) )  // Nitrogen = 14.007
00202       an=7;
00203     else if ( (mass >= 15.9) && (mass <= 16.1) )  // Oxygen = 15.9990
00204       an=8;
00205     else if ( (mass >= 18.9) && (mass <= 19.0) )  // Fluorine = 18.99800
00206       an=9;
00207     else if ( (mass >= 20.0) && (mass <= 20.2) ) // Neon = 20.1797
00208       an=10;
00209     else if ( (mass >= 22.9) && (mass <= 23.0) ) // Sodium = 22.989770
00210       an=11;
00211     else if ( (mass >= 24.3) && (mass <= 24.4) ) // Magnesium = 24.305000
00212       an=12;
00213     else if ( (mass >= 30.0) && (mass <= 31.0) )  // Phosphorus = 30.974000
00214       an=15;
00215     else if ( (mass >= 32.0) && (mass <= 32.1) )  // Sulfur = 32.0600
00216       an=16;
00217     else if ( (mass >= 35.0) && (mass <= 36.0) )  // Chlorine = 35.45300
00218       an=17;
00219     else if ( (mass >= 39.0) && (mass <= 39.2) )  // Potassium = 39.102000
00220       an=19;
00221     else if ( (mass >= 40.0) && (mass <= 40.1) )  // Calcium = 40.0800
00222       an=20;
00223     else if ( (mass >= 55.0) && (mass <= 56.1) )  // Iron = 55.84700 
00224       an=26;
00225     else if ( (mass >= 65.3) && (mass <= 65.4) )  // Zinc = 65.37
00226       an=30;
00227     else if ( (mass >= 132.0) && (mass <= 133.0) )  // Cesium = 132.900000
00228       an=55;
00229     
00230     if (an > 0)
00231       return(an);
00232     else
00233       throw(std::out_of_range("Couldn't identify an atomic number in psf"));
00234   }
